4: ['text','Symbols in music have many different shapes and uses.']
5: ['text','They are useful because they give us information quickly, without us having to read words.']
6: ['text','Symbols which are attached to notes are normally written on the opposite side to the stem.']
7: ['text','These are the symbols you need to know for Grade One Music Theory. Make sure you know how to explain each one in words! If the symbol has a foreign name, such as staccato, you need to know how to explain it in English in the exam, for full marks.']
10: ['text','Ties and slurs look the same, but a tie always joins together two identical notes, and a slur always connects non-identical notes. For more on ties, see Lesson 4 - Tied Notes.']
12: ['text','The two (or more) notes should be played as one note.']
15: ['text','The two (or more) notes should be played smoothly.']
20: ['text','Accent. Attack the note with a hard force.']
24: ['text','Staccato. Play the note short and detached.']
28: ['text','Pause (or fermata). Hold on to the note for some time longer than real value of the note.']
38: ['text','Single repeat bar. Go back to the beginning and repeat everything up to this bar.']
40: ['text','Double repeat bars. Repeat everything between the two repeat bars.']
